content: sherri crochets & crafts proudly presents the great white shark pattern designed by sherri bush copyright february 2007 this pattern may not be distributed or sold by anyone other than myself you may make and construct this pattern and sell what you make from this pattern but you may not sell or give away the pattern itself page 1 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com great white shark pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook worsted weight yarn red heart super saver works nicely  a blue grey for the body and fins i used red heart s country blue  a white or very light color for the underbody gauge is unimportant for this project finished shark is about 7 inches long from tip of nose to tip of tail terms single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together work even = single_crochet in each single_crochet around or in that row note this shark is worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic magic_ring be creative and have fun page 2 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com head and body row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook or use a magic_ring join 6 chain 1 2 work even 6 3 *1 single_crochet 1 increase* around 9 4 increase in first 2 stitches single_crochet around increase in last 2 stitches 13 5 repeat row 4 17 6 work even 17 7 4 single_crochet 2 increase 5 single_crochet 2 increase 4 single_crochet 21 8 10 single_crochet 2 increase 9 single_crochet 23 9 work even 23 10 4 single_crochet 2 increase 11 single_crochet 2 increase 4 single_crochet 27 11 work even 27 18 19 *7 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 24 20 work even 24 22 23 *4 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 20 stuff nose and head 24 work even 20 25 26 *3 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 16 27 work even 16 28 *2 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 12 stuff more 29 work even 12 30 *1 single_crochet 1 decrease* around 8 finish stuffing the head and body make it firm but not so firm the stitches stretch out
